data.text: An Ultra Lightweight Bivvy for Bikepack Racing?

Does anyone have any recommendations for an ultra lightweight bivvy intended to be used for bikepack racing for just a couple hours of rest or as a weather shelter? I’ve spent some time researching, but information is sporadic as most prefer tents. Thought I’d ask here. Thanks!
Just bought this. Recommended by Dirty Teeth. May work for you.
data.author: Paul Fuller

data.text:
I use this … pretty minimalist and surprisingly does not sweat too much https://www.surviveoutdoorslonger.com/survive-outdoors-longer-escape-bivvy.html
Escape Bivvy
surviveoutdoorslonger.com
data.author: Tahi Cunningham

data.text: I usually just sleep in a bug net bivy when the weather is clear, but I carry this dyneema tarp just in case. It's not claustrophobic, you won't get wet from breath condensation which you will in a waterproof bivy, and the tarp weighs like 175grams or something, I can't remember what the single carbon fiber pole weighs. Way better experience for me and packs so light I don't mind carrying it. If you don't need it, save time by crawling into just a basic bug net.

data.text: I'd opt for the Helium Bivi by Outdoor Redearch if you can get hold of one, those emergency bivvy aren't top sweaty, if it's just for a couple of hours a wee space blanket and liner/bivvy could work. The lightest and most affordable one person tent I can think of is Alpkit Soloist...1.3kg I believe maybe 1.2 ✨️
